subject: Sales
title: The Mall: Retail's Golden Age
description: A 60-second lesson on The Mall: Retail's Golden Age.

hook.text: Southdale Center opened in 1956 as America's first enclosed mall. Shopping became pure entertainment.

buildup.text: Malls combined stores, food courts, and social spaces. They were destinations, not just retail hubs.

discovery.text: Anchor stores drew foot traffic. Smaller shops paid premium rent for the crowds that anchors generated.

twist.text: E-commerce gutted the model. By 2020, over twenty percent of American malls had closed or were dying.

climax.text: The mall's enduring lesson: create an experience worth visiting and the selling handles itself.

punchline.text: The mall taught retail that experience is everything.

quiz.question: What killed the traditional mall model?
options: E-commerce offered convenience malls couldn't match
